@jeremy This is primarily a problem for legacy databases. Or for those of us with large datasets ie billions of rows the space saving made by using timestamp can really add up.

At the moment I do the following in config initializer


    require 'active_record/connection_adapters/mysql2_adapter'
    module ActiveRecord
      module ConnectionAdapters
        class Mysql2Adapter
          private
          alias old_configure_connection configure_connection
          def configure_connection
            old_configure_connection
            execute("SET SESSION time_zone='+0:00'", :skip_logging)
          end
        end
      end
    end

It would be great if there was a nicer way
